```{r setup, echo = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(root.dir = "D:/MA_Do_RProgramme/Anpassung an Verteilungen", 
                      message = FALSE, echo = TRUE)
library(knitr)
library(latex2exp)
library(kableExtra)

setwd("D:/MA_Do_RProgramme/Anpassung an Verteilungen")

# Laden des `kable`-Objekts aus der .txt-Datei
gleason <- read.table("results_gleason.txt", sep = "\t", header = TRUE)
jorgensen <- read.table("results_jorgensen.txt", sep = "\t", header = TRUE)
leon <- read.table("results_leon.txt", sep = "\t", header = TRUE)
mack <- read.table("results_mack.txt", sep = "\t", header = TRUE)
makkar2012 <- read.table("results_makkar2012.txt", sep = "\t", header = TRUE)
makkar2020 <- read.table("results_makkar2020.txt", sep = "\t", header = TRUE)
popma <- read.table("results_popma.txt", sep = "\t", header = TRUE)
thyregod <- read.table("results_thyregod.txt", sep = "\t", header = TRUE)


# Kombinieren der Tabellen mit rbind()
combined_table <- rbind(gleason, jorgensen)
combined_table <- rbind(combined_table, leon)
combined_table <- rbind(combined_table, mack)
combined_table <- rbind(combined_table, makkar2012)
combined_table <- rbind(combined_table, makkar2020)
combined_table <- rbind(combined_table, popma)
combined_table <- rbind(combined_table, thyregod)

# SSE Spalte umformatieren damit da nicht nur 0 steht
format_sse <- function(value) {
  if (value == 0) {
    return("0")
  } else {
    return(sprintf("%.2e", value))
  }
}

combined_table$SSE <- sapply(combined_table$SSE, format_sse)

# mix Parameter transformieren
combined_table$X..psi. <- exp(combined_table$X..psi.) / ( 1 + exp(combined_table$X..psi.))

result <- xtable::xtable(combined_table, caption = "Deine Tabelle", label = "tab:deine_tabelle")

print(combined_table)
```
